availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Coleman D. Cooper (Shelby County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Shelby County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Nancy Jane Salmons on August 13, 1844. Father of [unknown] Cooper, McHenry Cooper, Mary A. M. Cooper, Benjamin H. Cooper, Nancy J. Cooper, and Walter Cooper. Farmer in Shelby County in 1860. Corporal in the Spencer County State Guard from September 8, 1862, to October 30, 1862.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Shelby County, District 2, p. 135.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Shelby County, District 7, p. 532A.
Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Mortality Schedules, Kentucky, Shelby County, Harrisonville, p. 1.
Kentucky, County Marriage Records, 1783-1965, Film #000259289, Shelby County, August 13, 1844 (accessed via ancestry.com).
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1867), 857.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), Shelby County, KY, 1863, p. 46 (accessed via ancestry.com).
